page.title: 17 Ragley Hall-Tourism
page.content: Ragley Hall is a main attraction and an interesting place to look around. Its many features include the adventure wood,shop,arcade and B.M.X(bicyles) and motor bikes to ride.There is also a lake where sailing takes place and Ragley Hall itself with its highly decorative rooms. In the gardens,there are many other features including a nature trail, horse stables,a painting gallery and an old ice-house used many centuries ago to store food.Annually Ragley is the setting for horse trails,often attended by Captain Mark Philips and Princess Anne.Also annually are go-cart races and polo. If you live locally,you can obtain a fishing permit which enables you to fish in the lake.To visit the Hall it costs 50p/child,1.00/adult(all grounds) 1.00/child,2.00/adult(ground & house)
